banner2.content: When you and your audience can picture every tree, shrub, rock, snag, or building—you’re better equipped to communicate a point or make informed decisions. Use detailed forest visualization to support specific talking points or create a compelling visual story.
banner2.subtitle: Better Decisions
banner2.title: Better research,

capture.content: Elevate any presentation with stunning, detailed visuals. Stand Designer includes tools to capture still images and videos at resolutions up to 3840 x 2160 pixels. Built-in tools also allow you to create elaborate video fly-throughs and utilize “offline rendering”, a technique which guarantees a smooth frame-rate on exported videos, even if they were recorded on a slow PC.
capture.title: Capture

features.content: If you have an interest in natural resources, it probably isn’t because you like staring at data tables. In our industry, we are all visual people. Forest visualization allows us to move from raw numbers and industry jargon to something that anyone can understand. When we visualize our data, we can interpret more data at once, we can interpret it faster, we can see trends more easily, and we can communicate with a larger audience. So, immerse yourself in forest data and see the forest for the trees.
features.content2: With a company history spanning more than 30 years in California forestry, we know that you would rather be in the field. As a result, we’ve created a platform that combines ease of use with unparalleled attention to detail when looking at a forest from the ground-level perspective. To use Stand Designer, you select a four acre terrain to represent a slice from a larger landscape. Then, you can populate the terrain with trees, fill in the understory, and add special objects for scale, function, or aesthetics. You can choose to quickly import data and use pre-made templates or you can customize the scene to try and match a photo, your notes, or a detailed treatment plan.
features.subtitle: Visualization
features.subtitle2: Ease of Use Meets Unparalleled Detail
features.title: Interactive

import.content: Bring your data to life with a few simple clicks. Just open Stand Designer, select a terrain or create one from location, and import your data. Our platform will populate your trees across the landscape, allowing you to take a walk without ever leaving your desk.
import.title: Import

model.content: A Visual Forester stand model is the next best thing to a walk in the woods. Our in-house library includes hundreds of 3D models covering forestland in the United States and Canada.
model.title: Model

quantify.content: Whether you import your stand tables or build a stand from scratch, Stand Designer will estimate tree volume and biomass using FIA equations. You can click on any individual tree to get its biometric data or view data summaries in tables and graphs.
quantify.title: Quantify

requirements.content: With major topics like carbon planning, wildfire risk management, and wildlife habitat conservation, it is more important than ever that we effectively communicate forest data and decision making to students, collaborators, and stakeholders with diverse specialties and backgrounds. Stand Designer offers simple, versatile tools for natural resources professionals, students, educators, landowners, regulators, and community members to share and understand forest conditions through immersive visualization.
requirements.slogan: With Stand Designer, we bring the forest to you.
requirements.subtitle: Visualization is Now
requirements.title: The Time for Forest

simulate.content: Our most recent feature is the incorporation of fire. You can watch a fire spread over the landscape in real-time, engulfing trees and turning them into blackened snags.
simulate.title: Simulate

text.content: Import forest data and see it from a new perspective.
Access a practical suite of tools for building a detailed scene and displaying precise information.
Build charts and tables using common forest metrics.
Tools to import forest data or build a scene from scratch. Keep it simple OR use polygons, structure layers, and optional parameters to develop complex scenes.
Place objects visually. Develop "lists" of common plants and objects, then re-use the lists in other scenes.
Watch your scene develop in real time.
Divide plants and objects into different structure layers. Toggle the visibility on and off to focus on different parts of the stand.

Use the drone camera to get a birds eye view, walk the ground like you would in real life, or produce orthographic views like you might find in a text book.  Each method will give you a brand new perspective.
Click the help icon in the upper right of any panel to get detailed assistance.
Create high quality videos of your project using our camera path building tool.  Running slow on your computer?  That’s okay, render frame-by-frame to get a smooth video every time.
Click and drag to adjust camera points and other objects.

seo.title: Stand Designer - Advanced, Photorealistic Forest Visualization Software
seo.metaDesc: Stand Designer provides a suite of tools to convert common forest data, like stand tables, into eye-catching and easy-to-understand visuals.
seo.opengraphTitle: Stand Designer - Advanced, Photorealistic Forest Visualization Software
